verses.roman:
svā-mādhurya āsvādite karena yatana
bhakta-bhāva vinu nahe tāhā āsvādana

synonyms: svā-mādhurya—the sweetness of Himself; āsvādite—to taste; karena yatana—makes endeavors; bhakta-bhāva—the emotion of being a devotee; vinu—without; nahe—there is not; tāhā—that; āsvādana—tasting.
translation: He tries to taste His own sweetness, but He cannot do so without accepting the emotions of a devotee.

purport.content: Lord Śrī Kṛṣṇa wanted to relish the transcendental mellow of a devotee, and therefore He accepted the role of a devotee by appearing as Śrī Kṛṣṇa Caitanya Mahāprabhu.
